fr.sorbonne_u.components.plugins.helpers

Interface ClientSidePluginI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractClientSidePlugin, DataInterfacePushControlClientSidePlugin

    public interface ClientSidePluginI
    The interface ClientSidePluginI declares the methods that a client plug-in uses to connect with a server-side plug-in on a given component interface with given ports and connector.

    Description

    This interface and its companion abstract class can be used to facilitate the creation of client-side plug-in that needs to connect dynamically to their server-side component.

    The important aspect of this plug-in is that the URI management between the client and server components is limited to the fact that the client component initiating the connection knows the URI of the reflection inbound port of the server component. Using this information, it can connect to this port and retrieve the information about other ports URI of the server using the ReflectionI component interface.

    The two major ways to get the reflection inbound port URI of a component are:

    1. to have a constant string accessible to both components and which is passed as parameter to the server component constructor;
    2. to create the server component using the dynamic component creator using the createComponent method which returns this URI.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2019-03-06

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean connectWithServerSide(java.lang.String serverReflectionInboundPortURI)
      connect the outbound port to the server of the given reflection inbound port URI.
      void disconnectFromServerSide()
      disconnect the outbound port from the server-side.
      AbstractOutboundPort getOutboundPort()
      return the outbound port managed by this plug-in or null if it has not been created yet; should be overridden with the precise return type of the actual outbound port required interface to ease the calling of this interface methods.
      boolean isConnectedToServerSide()
      true if the plug-in is connected to a server side plug-in.

      • connectWithServerSide

        boolean connectWithServerSide(java.lang.String serverReflectionInboundPortURI)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        connect the outbound port to the server of the given reflection inbound port URI.

        Contract

         pre    serverReflectionInboundPortURI != null
 post   !ret || this.isConnectedToServerSide()
        Parameters:
        serverReflectionInboundPortURI - URI of the reflection inbound port of the server component.
        Returns:
        true if the connection was made successfully.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the server-side component does not have an inbound port of the needed offered interface.

      • getOutboundPort
